snippet: ABC had its best end-of-the-year prime-time numbers since 2000 with coverage of the ball dropping in Times Square, according to preliminary results.
abstract: ABC had its best end-of-the-year prime-time numbers since 2000 with coverage of the ball dropping in Times Square, according to preliminary results.
lead_paragraph: ABC extended "Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve" on Saturday night, and it appeared to pay off, giving the network its best end-of-the-year prime-time ratings since 2000. The two new hours of New Year's Eve merriment, from 8 to 10 p.m., drew about 8.3 million viewers, an unusually high number for a Saturday night. Repeats on the other networks drew between 1.5 million and 3 million viewers.

headline.main: 'New Year's Rockin' Eve' Draws Strong Ratings
